criterion: Does the vendor hold a valid, externally validated international security certification?

maturity_levels.1: Claims alignment ("We follow ISO standards") but no certificate.
maturity_levels.2: Certificate exists but is expired OR scope is limited to data centers only (not the SaaS app).
maturity_levels.3: Valid ISO 27001 Certificate covering the relevant service.
maturity_levels.4: ISO 27001 + ISO 27017 (Cloud Security) or ISO 27018 (Cloud Privacy).

criterion: Has the vendor undergone an independent AICPA service organization control audit?
osint_source: Trust Center / Compliance Portal (NDA often req.)

maturity_levels.1: Vendor relies solely on hosting provider's report (e.g., "We run on AWS who is SOC 2").
maturity_levels.2: SOC 3 (Public Summary) or SOC 2 Type I (Point-in-time snapshot) only.
maturity_levels.3: SOC 2 Type II Report (Covering a period of 6-12 months).
maturity_levels.4: SOC 2 Type II + "Bridge Letter" (covering the gap between audit period and now).
maturity_levels.5: SOC 2 Type II + SOC 2+ (Plus) or continuous audit dashboard availability.

criterion: Is the vendor transparently registered with the Cloud Security Alliance (STAR) registry?

maturity_levels.0: Not listed in the STAR Registry.
maturity_levels.1: Listed, but the CAIQ (Questionnaire) is over 2 years old.
maturity_levels.3: Self-Assessment + Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) mapping provided.

criterion: What mechanisms are available to integrate with our corporate identity providers?

maturity_levels.1: Social Login only (e.g., "Sign in with Google/GitHub" - non-managed).
maturity_levels.3: SAML/OIDC SSO Available (But requires expensive "Enterprise" upgrade).
maturity_levels.4: SAML/OIDC SSO Included in standard business licensing.
maturity_levels.5: Just-in-Time (JIT) Provisioning + SCIM Support for automated onboarding/offboarding.

criterion: How strictly can we enforce Multi-Factor Authentication on our user accounts?

maturity_levels.3: Enforced MFA (Admin can force all users to enroll).
maturity_levels.5: Phishing-Resistant MFA Support (FIDO2 / WebAuthn / Hardware Keys) enforced.

criterion: To what extent can we monitor user activity and detect potential security incidents?

maturity_levels.1: "Recent Activity" view for users only (no admin oversight).
maturity_levels.2: Admin Dashboard View (Non-exportable, short retention e.g., 30 days).
maturity_levels.4: Automated API Access / Webhooks for SIEM ingestion.
maturity_levels.5: Granular CRUD Logging (Create, Read, Update, Delete) + Real-time Streaming API.

criterion: How is our data cryptographically protected while stored on the vendor's servers?

maturity_levels.1: "Data is encrypted" (Vague statement, no technical specs).
maturity_levels.3: AES-256 with specific Key Management procedures defined in whitepaper.
maturity_levels.5: Client-Side Encryption / Zero Knowledge (Vendor technically cannot see data).

criterion: Can we control the geographic location where our data is processed and stored?

maturity_levels.1: General region stated (e.g., "Servers are in the US").
maturity_levels.4: Contractual Guarantee of residency (Data will not leave X region).
maturity_levels.5: Sovereign Cloud offering (Data processed by nationals of that country only).

criterion: Does the vendor provide transparency regarding the software components they use?

maturity_levels.2: List of critical sub-processors (hosting providers) listed.
maturity_levels.3: Full list of sub-processors available and updated regularly.
maturity_levels.4: SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) available upon request.
maturity_levels.5: Real-time SBOM + VEX (Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange) published.

criterion: How transparent is the vendor regarding system uptime, outages, and historical incidents?

maturity_levels.1: Static "Traffic Light" (Up/Down) page, current status only.
maturity_levels.2: Status page with recent history (last 30 days).
maturity_levels.3: Detailed Status Page with historical post-mortems and subscription alerts.
maturity_levels.4: Financially-backed SLA (Service Level Agreement) for uptime.
maturity_levels.5: Real-time metrics published + Public "Trust Center" showing live control status.

criterion: How easy is it for security researchers to report vulnerabilities to this vendor?

maturity_levels.4: Public Bug Bounty Program (e.g., HackerOne, Bugcrowd).
maturity_levels.5: Bug Bounty with "Safe Harbor" clause explicitly protecting researchers.
